Japanese:
お願い！！
ザ・バーガーのお店を全部、
どこか遠くに運んでくれない？
English:
Please!!
Can't you move all of {The Burger} stores to somewhere far away?

Japanese:
いろんなところに
あの店が……。
English: That store has more than one location...

Japanese:
ハンバーガーの店
/c5ザ・バーガー/c3か。

よく見ると、ずいぶん
いっぱい店があるんだなぁ。
English: On closer inspection, there seems to be quite a few of them.

Japanese:
よりによって、
うちのお店の近くに
２店もできたのよ。
English: Worse than that, there's two of them really close to our store.

Japanese:
おかげで
お客さん、減っちゃってて……。
English: Thanks to them, the number of customers we get keeps dropping...
That's why you looked so down.

Japanese:
ミオががんばれば、お客さん
だって、また戻ってくるさ。
English: But if you keep working hard, you'll soon get back the numbers you used to get.

Japanese: アンマリー＿イライラする

あんたたち……
やけに親切じゃない。
English: You're... being awfully kind all of the sudden.

Japanese: 警報！　オートマンか！
English: The siren! Is it an Automan?!

Japanese:
ケイ、/p。
来てくれたんだ？

何かあったのか？
気になったからさ。
English:
Has something happened?
We were worried.

Japanese: アンマリー＿イライラする
で、なんなの？　この女は？
English: So, what's going on? Who is this girl?

Japanese:
最近、お店にお客さんが
減ってて。
English: The store's been getting less and less customers recently.

Japanese:
こないだ開店したばかり
なんだぜ。

今日は俺のおごりだ。
腹いっぱい食べてくれ。
English: Today's my treat. Eat till your heart's content.

Japanese: アンマリー＿挑発する等

あんたがおごるなんて、
雨でもふらなきゃいいけど。
English: So you're going to treat us? What's next, are pigs going to start flying?

Japanese:
人の好意は
素直に受けろよ！
English: Can't you just happily accept my good will?!

Japanese: アンマリー＿親しい人と話す

言っとくけど、
私は育ち盛りだからね。
結構食べるよ。
English: For your information, I'm still growing. I can eat my fair share.

Japanese: ミオ＿ちょっとした驚き

English: Have you come to visit the store?

Japanese: 後で店に寄ってみるか？
English: Should we drop by the store afterwards?
